page.title: 20Current Concerns.
page.content: The main talking point in the summer of 1985 was the appallingly{wet {weather,}which had spoiled holidays and many open-air events. The prospect, or reality of{unemployment is a great cause of anxiety, and many wonder whether the situation will ever improve. {Parents are very worried that their children might finish full time eduation and not find a job. Thus there is pressure on schools to "deliver the goods" in terms of {academic results. }The threat of {nuclear war}is still a real cause of alarm, felt most acutely by younger folk. Many people express concern about the{falling moral standards}in British society: the increase in {violence,}the growth in the{divorce rate, the{drug addiction}problem. Very few have any answers.
